title: How to Make Cheesy Garlic Bread

steps.headline: Cut the bread in half horizontally.
steps.description: If the bread is too long for the cookie sheet, cut each end of the bread to be able to fit in the sheet.

steps.headline: Place both sides of the bread on a cookie sheet with the cut side facing up.
In a small bowl, mix butter and garlic and spread evenly on the bread slices, using a spoon or a spatula.
With the back of a spoon or a spatula, press the garlic butter combination down on the bread so the garlic pieces are pushed into the air pockets of the bread.
When oven is ready, put the cookie sheet in for 15 minutes and remove from the oven.
Change the oven setting to high broil so that you can put the bread back in later.
Either sprinkle the cheese over the bread then, sprinkle the chopped parsley, or mix in the chopped parsley with the cheese in a bowl and sprinkle the mixture over the bread.
steps.description: Either way, make sure to sprinkle the cheese and parsley evenly over the bread slices.

steps.headline: When the oven is ready, put the bread back in to broil for 1 minute or until the cheese has completely melted and is golden in a few places.
Remove from the oven and slice the bread diagonally, making sure not to squeeze the bread while doing so.

tyn: Bread Knife and a regular knife
text: Preheat oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Cut the bread in half horizontally. If the bread is too long for the cookie sheet, cut each end of the bread to be able to fit in the sheet. Place both sides of the bread on a cookie sheet with the cut side facing up.  In a small bowl, mix butter and garlic and spread evenly on the bread slices, using a spoon or a spatula.  With the back of a spoon or a spatula, press the garlic butter combination down on the bread so the garlic pieces are pushed into the air pockets of the bread.  When oven is ready, put the cookie sheet in for 15 minutes and remove from the oven.  Change the oven setting to high broil so that you can put the bread back in later.  Either sprinkle the cheese over the bread then, sprinkle the chopped parsley, or mix in the chopped parsley with the cheese in a bowl and sprinkle the mixture over the bread. Either way, make sure to sprinkle the cheese and parsley evenly over the bread slices. When the oven is ready, put the bread back in to broil for 1 minute or until the cheese has completely melted and is golden in a few places.  Remove from the oven and slice the bread diagonally, making sure not to squeeze the bread while doing so.  Enjoy!
